\f0\fs24 \cf0 [Harry Potter]149-harry and [the Sorcerer]583-the sorcerer 's Stone\ \ \ CHAPTER ONE\ \ [THE BOY WHO LIVED\ \ [Mr.]584-mr. and [Mrs. Dursley]150-mr. dursley , of number four , [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]150-mr. dursley , were proud to say\ that [they]585-they were perfectly normal , thank [you]586-you very much . [They]585-they were [the last\ people [you]586-you 'd expect to be involved in anything strange or mysterious,\ because [they]585-they just did n't hold with such nonsense.\ \ [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley was the director of [a firm called [Grunnings]2-grunnings]588-a firm called grunnings , which made\ drills]587-the last\ people you 'd expect to be involved in anything strange or mysterious,\ because they just did n't hold with such nonsense.\ \ mr. dursley was the director of a firm called grunnings , which made\ drills . [He]150-mr. dursley was [a big , beefy man with hardly any neck]589-a big , beefy man with hardly any neck , although [he]150-mr. dursley did\ have a very large mustache . [Mrs. Dursley]150-mr. dursley was thin and blonde and had\ nearly twice the usual amount of neck , which came in very useful as [she\]150-mr. dursley spent so much of [her]590-her time craning over garden fences , spying on [the\ neighbors]591-the\ neighbors . [The Dursleys]151-the dursleys had [a small son]592-a small son called [Dudley]152-dudley and in [their\]151-the dursleys opinion there was [no finer boy]593-no finer boy anywhere.\ \ [The Dursleys]151-the dursleys had everything [they]151-the dursleys wanted , but [they]151-the dursleys also had a secret , and\ [their]151-the dursleys greatest fear was that [somebody]594-somebody would discover it . [They]151-the dursleys didn't\ think [they]151-the dursleys could bear it if [anyone]595-anyone found out about [the Potters]153-the potters . [Mrs.\ Potter]154-potter was [[Mrs. Dursley]150-mr. dursley 's sister]596-mrs. dursley 's sister , but [they]597-they had n't met for several years;\ in fact , [Mrs. Dursley]150-mr. dursley pretended [she]596-mrs. dursley 's sister did n't have [a sister]598-a sister , because [[her\]150-mr. dursley sister]599-her\ sister and [[her]599-her\ sister good - for - nothing husband]600-her good - for - nothing husband were as unDursleyish as it was\ possible to be . [The Dursleys]151-the dursleys shuddered to think what [the neighbors]601-the neighbors would\ say if [the Potters]153-the potters arrived in [the street]602-the street . [The Dursleys]151-the dursleys knew that [the\ Potters]153-the potters had [a small son]592-a small son , too , but [they]151-the dursleys had never even seen [him]592-a small son . [This boy\]604-this boy\ was another good reason for keeping [the Potters]605-the potters away ; [they]151-the dursleys did n't want\ [Dudley]152-dudley mixing with [a child like that.\]606-a child like that.\ \ When [Mr.]607-mr. and [Mrs. Dursley]150-mr. dursley woke up on the dull , gray Tuesday [our]608-our story\ starts , there was nothing about the cloudy sky outside to suggest that\ strange and mysterious things would soon be happening all over [the\ country]609-the\ country . [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley hummed as [he]150-mr. dursley picked out [his]150-mr. dursley most boring tie for\ work , and [Mrs. Dursley]150-mr. dursley gossiped away happily as [she]610-she wrestled a screaming\ [Dudley]152-dudley into [his]150-mr. dursley high chair.\ \ [None of [them]612-them]611-none of them noticed a large , tawny owl flutter past the window.\ \ At half past eight , [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley picked up [his]150-mr. dursley briefcase , pecked [Mrs.\ Dursley]155-mrs.\ dursley on the cheek , and tried to kiss [Dudley]152-dudley good - bye but missed,\ because [Dudley]152-dudley was now having a tantrum and throwing [his]152-dudley cereal at the\ walls . " Little tyke , "[150-mr. dursley] chortled [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley as [he]150-mr. dursley left [the house]613-the house . [He]150-mr. dursley got\ into [[his]150-mr. dursley car]614-his car and backed out of [number four 's drive.\]615-number four 's drive.\ \ It was on the corner of [the street]602-the street that [he]150-mr. dursley noticed the first sign of\ something peculiar -- a cat reading a map . For a second , [Mr. Dursley\]156-mr. dursley\ did n't realize what [he]150-mr. dursley had seen -- then [he]150-mr. dursley jerked [his]150-mr. dursley head around to\ look again . There was a tabby cat standing on the corner of [Privet\ Drive]3-privet\ drive , but there was n't a map in sight . What could [he]150-mr. dursley have been thinking\ of ? It must have been a trick of the light . [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley blinked and\ stared at the cat . It stared back . As [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley drove around the\ corner and up [the road]617-the road , [he]150-mr. dursley watched the cat in [his]150-mr. dursley mirror . It was now\ reading the sign that said [Privet Drive]1-privet drive -- no , looking at the sign ; cats\ could n't read maps or signs . [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley gave [himself]150-mr. dursley a little shake and\ put the cat out of [his]150-mr. dursley mind . As [he]150-mr. dursley drove toward [town]618-town [he]150-mr. dursley thought of\ nothing except a large order of drills [he]150-mr. dursley was hoping to get that day.\ \ But on [the edge of [town]618-town]619-the edge of town , drills were driven out of [his]150-mr. dursley mind by something\ else . As [he]150-mr. dursley sat in the usual morning traffic jam , [he]150-mr. dursley could n't help\ noticing that there seemed to be a lot of [strangely dressed people\ about]621-strangely dressed people\ about . [People in cloaks]622-people in cloaks . [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley could n't bear people who dressed in\ funny clothes -- the getups [you]623-you saw on [young people]624-young people ! [He]150-mr. dursley supposed this\ was some stupid new fashion . [He]150-mr. dursley drummed [his]150-mr. dursley fingers on the steering\ wheel and [his]150-mr. dursley eyes fell on [a huddle of these weirdos standing quite\ close by]625-a huddle of these weirdos standing quite\ close by . [They]625-a huddle of these weirdos standing quite\ close by were whispering excitedly together . [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley was\ enraged to see that [a couple of [them]625-a huddle of these weirdos standing quite\ close by]626-a couple of them were n't young at all ; why , [that man\]627-that man\ had to be older than [he]627-that man\ was , and wearing an emerald - green cloak ! The\ nerve of [him]627-that man\ ! But then it struck [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley that this was probably some\ silly stunt -- [these people]628-these people were obviously collecting for something ... \ yes , that would be it . The traffic moved on and a few minutes later , [Mr.\ Dursley]157-mr.\ dursley arrived in [the Grunnings parking lot]629-the grunnings parking lot , [his]157-mr.\ dursley mind back on drills.\ \ [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley always sat with [his]157-mr.\ dursley back to the window in [[his]157-mr.\ dursley office on [the\ ninth floor]631-the\ ninth floor]630-his office on the\ ninth floor . If [he]150-mr. dursley had n't , [he]150-mr. dursley might have found it harder to concentrate\ on drills that morning . [He]150-mr. dursley did n't see the owls swoop ing past in broad\ daylight , though [[people]632-people down in [the street]602-the street]633-people down in the street did ; [they]632-people pointed and gazed\ open- mouthed as owl after owl sped overhead . [Most of [them]632-people]635-most of them had never\ seen an owl even at nighttime . [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley , however , had a perfectly\ normal , owl - free morning . [He]150-mr. dursley yelled at [five different people]636-five different people . [He]150-mr. dursley made\ several important telephone calls and shouted a bit more . [He]150-mr. dursley was in a\ very good mood until lunchtime , when [he]150-mr. dursley thought [he]150-mr. dursley 'd stretch [his]150-mr. dursley legs\ and walk across [the road]617-the road to buy [himself]150-mr. dursley a bun from [the bakery.\]638-the bakery.\ \ [He]150-mr. dursley 'd forgotten all about [the people in cloaks]639-the people in cloaks until [he]150-mr. dursley passed [a group of\ [them]639-the people in cloaks next to [the baker]641-the baker 's]640-a group of\ them next to the baker 's . [He]150-mr. dursley eyed [them]640-a group of\ them next to the baker 's angrily as [he]150-mr. dursley passed . [He]150-mr. dursley didn't\ know why , but [they]640-a group of\ them next to the baker 's made [him]150-mr. dursley uneasy . [This bunch]642-this bunch were whispering\ excitedly , too , and [he]150-mr. dursley could n't see a single collecting tin . It was on\ [his]150-mr. dursley way back past [them]640-a group of\ them next to the baker 's , clutching a large doughnut in a bag , that [he\]150-mr. dursley caught a few words of what [they]640-a group of\ them next to the baker 's were saying.\ \ " [The Potters]153-the potters , that 's right , that 's what [I]640-a group of\ them next to the baker 's heard yes , [[their]153-the potters son]2442-their son , [Harry"\]158-harry"\[640-a group of\ them next to the baker 's] \ [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley stopped dead . Fear flooded [him]150-mr. dursley . [He]150-mr. dursley looked back at [the\ whisperers]643-the\ whisperers as if [he]150-mr. dursley wanted to say something to [them]643-the\ whisperers , but thought better\ of it.\ \ [He]150-mr. dursley dashed back across [the road]617-the road , hurried up to [[his]150-mr. dursley office]645-his office , snapped at [[his\]150-mr. dursley secretary]646-his\ secretary not to disturb [him]150-mr. dursley , seized [his]150-mr. dursley telephone , and had almost\ finished dialing [his]150-mr. dursley home number when [he]150-mr. dursley changed [his]150-mr. dursley mind . [He]150-mr. dursley put the\ receiver back down and stroked [his]150-mr. dursley mustache , thinking ... no , [he]150-mr. dursley was\ being stupid . [Potter]154-potter was n't such an unusual name . [Harry Potter]149-harry rolled over inside [his\]759-his\ blankets without waking up . One small hand closed on the letter beside\ [him]149-harry and [he]149-harry slept on , not knowing [he]149-harry was special , not knowing [he]149-harry was\ famous , not knowing [he]149-harry would be woken in a few hours ' time by [Mrs.\ Dursley]155-mrs.\ dursley 's scream as [she]760-she opened the front door to put out the milk\ bottles , nor that [he]149-harry would spend the next few weeks being prodded and\ pinched by [[his]149-harry cousin]761-his cousin [Dudley]152-dudley ... The sun rose on [the same tidy front gardens]765-the same tidy front gardens and lit up the brass\ number four on [the Dursleys]151-the dursleys ' front door ; it crept into [[their]151-the dursleys living\ room]766-their living\ room , which was almost exactly the same as [it]766-their living\ room had been on the night when\ [Mr. Dursley]150-mr. dursley had seen that fateful news report about the owls . Only the\ photographs on the mantelpiece really showed how much time had passed.\ Ten years ago , there had been lots of pictures of what looked like a\ large pink beach ball wearing different - colored bonnets -- but [Dudley\ Dursley]192-dudley\ was no longer [a baby]767-a baby , and now the photographs showed [a large\ blond boy]768-a large\ blond boy riding [his]768-a large\ blond boy first bicycle , on a carousel at the fair , playing a\ computer game with [[his]768-a large\ blond boy father]769-his father , being hugged and kissed by [his]768-a large\ blond boy mother.\ [The room]770-the room held no sign at all that [another boy]771-another boy lived in [the house]613-the house , too.\ \ Yet [Harry Potter]149-harry was still there , asleep at the moment , but not for\ long . [His]149-harry Aunt [Petunia]165-aunt petunia was awake and it was [her]165-aunt petunia shrill voice that made\ the first noise of the day.\ \ " Up ! Get up ! Now!"\[165-aunt petunia] \ [Harry]149-harry woke with a start . [[His]149-harry aunt]714-his aunt rapped on the door again.\ \ " Up ! "[714-his aunt] [she]714-his aunt screeched . [Harry]149-harry heard [her]714-his aunt walking toward [the kitchen]774-the kitchen and then\ the sound of the frying pan being put on the stove . [He]149-harry rolled onto [his\]149-harry back and tried to remember the dream [he]149-harry had been having . It had been a\ good one . There had been a flying motorcycle in [it]613-the house . [He]149-harry had a funny\ feeling [he]149-harry 'd had the same dream before.\ \ [[His]149-harry aunt]714-his aunt was back outside the door.\ \ " Are [you]149-harry up yet ? "[714-his aunt] [she]714-his aunt demanded.\ \ " Nearly , "[193-hagrid] said [Harry.\]193-hagrid \ " Well , get a move on , [I]149-harry want [you]714-his aunt to look after the bacon . And do n't [you\]714-his aunt dare let it burn , [I]149-harry want everything perfect on [Duddy]152-dudley 's birthday . "\[149-harry] \ [Harry]149-harry groaned.\ \ " What did [you]149-harry say ? "[714-his aunt] [[his]149-harry aunt]714-his aunt snapped through the door.\ \ " Nothing , nothing ... "\[714-his aunt] \ [Dudley]152-dudley 's birthday -- how could [he]149-harry have forgotten ? [Harry]149-harry got slowly out\ of bed and started looking for socks . [He]149-harry found a pair under [his]149-harry bed and,\ after pulling a spider off one of them , put them on . [Harry]149-harry was used to\ spiders , because the cupboard under the stairs was full of them , and\ that was where [he]149-harry slept.\ \ When [he]149-harry was dressed [he]149-harry went down [the hall]777-the hall into [the kitchen]774-the kitchen . The table\ was almost hidden beneath all [Dudley]152-dudley 's birthday presents . It looked as\ though [Dudley]152-dudley had gotten the new computer [he]152-dudley wanted , not to mention the\ second television and the racing bike . Exactly why [Dudley]152-dudley wanted [a\ racing bike]779-a\ racing bike was a mystery to [Harry]149-harry , as [Dudley]152-dudley was very fat and hated\ exercise -- unless of course it involved punching [somebody]594-somebody . [Dudley's\]194-dudley's\ favorite punching bag was [Harry]149-harry , but [he]149-harry could n't often catch [him]194-dudley's\ . [Harry\]195-harry\ did n't look it , but [he]195-harry\ was very fast.\ \ Perhaps it had something to do with living in [a dark cupboard]781-a dark cupboard , but [Harry\]195-harry\ had always been small and skinny for [his]195-harry\ age . [He]195-harry\ looked even smaller and\ skinnier than [he]195-harry\ really was because all [he]195-harry\ had to wear were old clothes\ of [Dudley]152-dudley 's , and [Dudley]152-dudley was about four times bigger than [he]195-harry\ was . [Harry\]195-harry\ had [a thin face , knobbly knees , black hair , and bright green eyes]782-a thin face , knobbly knees , black hair , and bright green eyes . [He\]195-harry\ wore round glasses held together with a lot of Scotch tape because of\ all the times [Dudley]152-dudley had punched [him]195-harry\ on the nose . The only thing [Harry\]195-harry\ liked about [his]195-harry\ own appearance was a very thin scar on [his]195-harry\ forehead that\ was shaped like a bolt of lightning . [He]195-harry\ had had it as long as [he]195-harry\ could\ remember , and the first question [he]195-harry\ could ever remember asking [his]195-harry\ Aunt\ [Petunia]165-aunt petunia was how [he]195-harry\ had gotten it.\ \ " In the car crash when [[your]195-harry\ parents]2491-your parents died , "[165-aunt petunia] [she]165-aunt petunia had said . " [He]197-uncle vernon ruffled [Dudley]152-dudley 's hair.\ \ At that moment the telephone rang and [Aunt Petunia]165-aunt petunia went to answer it\ while [Harry]149-harry and [Uncle Vernon]197-uncle vernon watched [Dudley]152-dudley unwrap the racing bike , a\ video camera , a remote control airplane , sixteen new computer games , and\ a VCR . " [She]203-aunt petunia\ jerked [her]203-aunt petunia\ head in [Harry]149-harry 's direction.\ \ [Dudley]152-dudley 's mouth fell open in horror , but [Harry]149-harry 's heart gave a leap . Every\ year on [Dudley]152-dudley 's birthday , [[his]152-dudley parents]2495-his parents took [him]152-dudley and [a friend]2496-a friend out for the\ day , to [adventure parks]2497-adventure parks , [hamburger restaurants]2498-hamburger restaurants , or the movies . [The whole house]2502-the whole house smelled of cabbage\ and [Mrs. Figg]204-mrs. figg made [him]149-harry look at photographs of all the cats [she]204-mrs. figg 'd ever\ owned.\ \ "[204-mrs. figg] Now what ? " said [Aunt Petunia]165-aunt petunia , looking furiously at [Harry]149-harry as though [he'd\]149-harry planned this . It was cool and dark in\ there , with lit windows all along the walls . Behind the glass , all sorts\ of lizards and snakes were crawling and slithering over bits of wood and\ stone . [Dudley]152-dudley and [Piers]213-piers wanted to see huge , poisonous cobras and thick,\ man - crushing pythons . [Dudley]152-dudley quickly found the largest snake in [the\ place]832-the\ place . [Everybody]2552-everybody knew that [[Dudley]152-dudley 's gang]813-dudley 's gang hated\ that odd [Harry Potter]149-harry in [his]149-harry baggy old clothes and broken glasses , and\ [nobody]2554-nobody liked to disagree with [Dudley]152-dudley 's gang.\ \ \ CHAPTER THREE\ \ THE LETTERS FROM [NO ONE\]2555-no one\ \ The escape of [the Brazilian boa constrictor]2556-the brazilian boa constrictor earned [Harry]149-harry his\ longest - ever punishment . [The rest of [them]2562-the rest of them]2562-the rest of them were all quite\ happy to join in [Dudley]152-dudley 's favorite sport : [Harry Hunting.\]149-harry \ This was why [Harry]149-harry spent as much time as possible out of [the house,\]2563-the house,\ wandering around and thinking about the end of the holidays , where [he\]149-harry could see a tiny ray of hope . [Dudley\]192-dudley\ thought this was very funny.\ \ "[845-they] [They]845-they stuff [people]632-people 's heads down the toilet the first day at [Stonewall,"\]19-stonewall,"\ [he]192-dudley\ told [Harry]149-harry . " Then [he]192-dudley\ ran , before\ [Dudley]152-dudley could work out what [he]192-dudley\ 'd said.\ \ One day in July , [Aunt Petunia]165-aunt petunia took [Dudley]152-dudley to [London]20-london to buy [his]152-dudley Smeltings\ uniform , leaving [Harry]149-harry at [Mrs. Figg]204-mrs. figg 's . [Mrs. Figg]204-mrs. figg wasn ' t as bad as\ usual . It turned out [she]204-mrs. figg 'd broken [her]204-mrs. figg leg tripping over one of [her]204-mrs. figg cats,\ and [she]204-mrs. figg did n't seem quite as fond of them as before . [She]204-mrs. figg let [Harry]149-harry watch\ television and gave [him]149-harry a bit of chocolate cake that tasted as though\ [she]204-mrs. figg 'd had it for several years.\ \ That evening , [Dudley]152-dudley paraded around [the living room]672-the living room for [the family]2569-the family in\ [his]152-dudley brand - new uniform . [Smeltings ' boys]2570-smeltings ' boys wore maroon tailcoats , orange\ knickerbockers , and flat straw hats called [boaters]2571-boaters . [They]2570-smeltings ' boys also carried\ knobbly sticks , used for hitting [each other]2572-each other while [the teachers]2573-the teachers weren't\ looking . This was supposed to be good training for later life.\ \ As [he]149-harry looked at [Dudley]152-dudley in [his]152-dudley new knickerbockers , [Uncle Vernon]197-uncle vernon said\ gruffly that it was the proudest moment of [his]197-uncle vernon life . Potter\]225-mr. h. potter\ \ [The Cupboard under the Stairs\ \ 4 Privet Drive\]2583-the cupboard under the stairs\ \ 4 privet drive\ \ Little Whinging\ \ [Surrey\]22-surrey\ \ The envelope was thick and heavy , made of yellowish parchment , and the\ address was written in emerald - green ink . [Aunt Petunia]165-aunt petunia found a few moldy blankets in [the second\ room]2655-the second\ room and made up a bed for [Dudley]152-dudley on the moth - eaten sofa . [She]165-aunt petunia and [Uncle\ Vernon]214-uncle\ vernon went off to the lumpy bed next door , and [Harry]149-harry was left to find\ the softest bit of floor [he]149-harry could and to curl up under the thinnest,\ most ragged blanket.\ \ The storm raged more and more ferociously as the night went on . [Harry\]195-harry\ could n't sleep . [He]149-harry shivered and turned over , trying to get comfortable,\ [his]149-harry stomach rumbling with hunger . [Dudley]152-dudley 's snores were drowned by the\ low rolls of thunder that started near midnight . [The hut]2654-the hut was full of\ sunlight , the storm was over , [Hagrid]193-hagrid [himself]193-hagrid was asleep on the collapsed\ sofa , and there was an owl rapping its claw on the window , a newspaper\ held in its beak.\ \ [Harry]149-harry scrambled to [his]149-harry feet , so happy [he]149-harry felt as though a large balloon\ was swelling inside [him]149-harry . "\[411-fang] \ The rock cakes were shapeless lumps with raisins that almost broke their\ teeth , but [Harry]149-harry and [Ron]468-ron pretended to be enjoying them as [they]1539-yer told\ [Hagrid]193-hagrid all about [their]1539-yer first -lessons . "\[412-fitch] \ " An ' as fer that cat , [Mrs. Norris]399-mrs. norris , [I]149-harry 'd like ter introduce [her]399-mrs. norris to [Fang\]410-fang\ sometime . [The vault\ that was searched]1543-the vault\ that was searched had in fact been emptied the same day.\ \ " But [we]3237-we 're not telling [you]149-harry what was in there , so keep [your]149-harry noses out if\ [you]149-harry know what 's good for [you]149-harry , "[253-gringotts] said [a Gringotts spokesgoblin]253-gringotts this\ afternoon.\ \ [Harry]149-harry remembered [Ron]468-ron telling [him]149-harry on [the train]2761-the train that [someone]874-someone had tried to\ rob [Gringotts]253-gringotts , but [Ron]468-ron had n't mentioned the date.\ \ " [Hagrid]193-hagrid ! And did [Hagrid]193-hagrid know something about\ [Snape]392-snape that [he]193-hagrid did n't want to tell [Harry?\]414-harry?\ \ \ CHAPTER NINE\ \ THE MIDNIGHT DUEL\ \ [Harry]149-harry had never believed [he]149-harry would meet [a boy [he]149-harry hated more than [Dudley,\]217-dudley,\]1552-a boy he hated more than dudley,\ but that was before [he]149-harry met [Draco Malfoy]339-malfoy . " Just what [I]149-harry always wanted . To make a fool\ of [myself]149-harry on a broomstick in front of [Malfoy]339-malfoy . "\[149-harry] \ [He]149-harry had been looking forward to learning to fly more than anything else.\ \ " [You]3239-you do n't know that [you]3239-you 'll make a fool of [yourself]3239-you , "[413-ron\] said [Ron\]413-ron\ reasonably . " Anyway , [I]413-ron\ know [Malfoy]339-malfoy 's always going on about how good [he\]339-malfoy is at [Quidditch]278-quidditch , but [I]413-ron\ bet that 's all talk . "\[413-ron\] \ [Malfay]415-malfay certainly did talk about flying a lot . [He]415-malfay complained loudly about\ first years never getting on [the house Quidditch teams]1555-the house quidditch teams and told long,\ boastful stories that always seemed to end with [him]415-malfay narrowly escaping\ Muggles in [helicopters]1556-helicopters . [He]415-malfay was n't the only one , though : the way [Seamus\ Finnigan]416-seamus\ finnigan told it , [he]416-seamus\ finnigan 'd spent most of [his]416-seamus\ finnigan childhood zooming around [the\ countryside]1557-the\ countryside on [his]416-seamus\ finnigan broomstick . Even [Ron]468-ron would tell anyone who 'd listen\ about the time [he]468-ron 'd almost hit a hang glider on [Charlie]316-charlie 's old broom.\ [Everyone from [wizarding families]1559-wizarding families]1558-everyone from wizarding families talked about [Quidditch]278-quidditch constantly . [Ron\]413-ron\ had already had a big argument with [Dean Thomas]263-dean , who shared [[their\]1560-their\ dormitory]1561-their\ dormitory , about soccer . [Ron]468-ron could n't see what was exciting about a game\ with only one ball where [no one]2479-no one was allowed to fly . Privately , [Harry]149-harry felt [she]1566-his\ grandmother 'd had\ good reason , because [Neville]306-neville managed to have an extraordinary number of\ accidents even with both feet on the ground.\ \ [Hermione Granger]334-hermione was almost as nervous about flying as [Neville]306-neville was . This\ was something [you]1567-you could n't learn by heart out of a book -- not that [she\]1566-his\ grandmother had n't tried . At breakfast on Thursday [she]1566-his\ grandmother bored [them]1565-the\ players all stupid with\ flying tips [she]1566-his\ grandmother 'd gotten out of a library book called [Quidditch]278-quidditch Through\ the Ages . [Neville]306-neville was hanging on to [her]1566-his\ grandmother every word , desperate for\ anything that might help [him]306-neville hang on to [his]306-neville broomstick later , but\ [everybody else]1568-everybody else was very pleased when [Hermione]334-hermione 's lecture was interrupted\ by the arrival of the mail.\ \ [Harry]149-harry had n't had a single letter since [Hagrid]193-hagrid 's note , something that\ [Malfoy]339-malfoy had been quick to notice , of course . [Harry]169-harry had heard [Fred]300-fred and [George Weasley\]419-george weasley\ complain about the school brooms , saying that some of them started to\ vibrate if [you]1582-you flew too high , or always flew slightly to the left.\ \ [[Their]1572-their teacher]1583-their teacher , [Madam Hooch]420-madam hooch , arrived . "\[428-wood] \ [Wood]428-wood 's expression changed from puzzlement to delight.\ \ " Are [you]169-harry serious , [Professor?"\]429-professor?"\[169-harry] \ " Absolutely , "[169-harry] said [Professor McGonagall]169-harry crisply . "[169-harry] [For Neville]306-neville had been tugging on the sleeve of\ [Harry]169-harry 's bathrobe for the last minute . For a moment , [he\]169-harry was sure [he]169-harry 'd walked into a nightmare -- this was too much , on top of\ everything that had happened so far.\ \ [They]1663-they were n't in [a room]895-a room , as [he]169-harry had supposed . [They]1663-they were in [a corridor]1666-a corridor . [The\ forbidden corridor on the third floor]1667-the\ forbidden corridor on the third floor . And now [they]1663-they knew why it was\ forbidden.\ \ [They]1663-they were looking straight into the eyes of a monstrous dog , a dog that\ filled the whole space between ceiling and floor . [It]1668-it had three heads.\ Three pairs of rolling , mad eyes ; three noses , twitching\ \ and quivering in [their]1663-they direction ; three drooling mouths , saliva hanging\ in slippery ropes from yellowish fangs.\ \ It was standing quite still , all six eyes staring at [them]1663-they , and [Harry\]195-harry\ knew that the only reason [they]1663-they were n't already dead was that [their\]1663-they sudden appearance had taken it by surprise , but it was quickly getting\ over that , there was no mistaking what those thunderous growls meant.\ \ [Harry]169-harry groped for the doorknob -- between [Filch]398-filch and death , [he]169-harry 'd take\ [Filch.\]446-filch.\ \ [They]1663-they fell backward -- [Harry]169-harry slammed the door shut , and [they]1663-they ran , [they\]1663-they almost flew , back down [the corridor]1509-the corridor . [Filch]398-filch must have hurried off to look\ for [them]1663-they somewhere else , because [they]1663-they did n't see [him]398-filch anywhere , but [they\]1663-they hardly cared -- all [they]1663-they wanted to do was put as much space as possible\ between [them]1663-they and that monster . What had [Hagrid]193-hagrid said?\ [Gringotts]253-gringotts was [the safest place in [the world]1020-the world for something [you]3298-you wanted to\ hide]3296-the safest place in the world for something you wanted to\ hide -- except perhaps [Hogwarts.\ \]93-hogwarts.\ \ [It]3299-it looked as though [Harry]169-harry had found out where the grubby littie package\ from [vault seven hundred and thirteen]2820-vault seven hundred and thirteen was.\ \ \ CHAPTER TEN\ \ [HALLOWEEN\ \ Malfoy]447-malfoy could n't believe [his]447-malfoy eyes when [he]447-malfoy saw that [Harry]169-harry and [Ron]468-ron were\ still at [Hogwarts]26-hogwarts the next day , looking tired but perfectly cheerful.\ Indeed , by the next morning [Harry]169-harry and [Ron]468-ron thought that meeting the\ three - headed dog had been an excellent adventure , and [they]3301-they were quite\ keen to have another one . "[1693-we] Swish and flick , remember , swish and flick . "\ \ It was very difficult . [Harry]189-harry and [Seamus]365-seamus swished and flicked , but the\ feather [they]1691-they were supposed to be sending skyward just lay on the\ desktop . [Seamus]365-seamus got so impatient that [he]365-seamus prodded it with [his]365-seamus wand and\ set fire to it -- [Harry]189-harry had to put it out with [his]189-harry hat.\ \ [Ron]468-ron , at the next table , was n't having much more luck.\ \ "[460-wizard baruffio,\] [Wingardium Leviosa]98-wingardium leviosa ! "\ \ \ "[1694-you] [You]1694-you do it , then , if [you]1694-you 're so clever , " [Ron]468-ron snarled.\ \ [Hermione]334-hermione rolled up the sleeves of [her]334-hermione gown , flicked [her]334-hermione wand , and said,\ "[1694-you] Wingardium Leviosa!"\ \ [Their]2460-everyone feather rose off the desk and hovered about four feet above [their\]2460-everyone heads.\ \ "[1694-you] Oh , well done ! [They]1704-they shrank into the shadows and\ watched as it emerged into a patch of moonlight.\ \ It was a horrible sight . Twelve feet tall , its skin was a dull , granite\ gray , its great lumpy body like a boulder with its small bald head\ perched on top like a coconut . It had short legs thick as tree trunks\ with flat , horny feet . The smell coming from it was incredible . There are\ some things [you]3403-you ca n't share without ending up liking [each other]2572-each other , and\ knocking out a twelve - foot mountain troll is one of them.\ \ \ CHAPTER ELEVEN\ \ [QUIDDITCH\]101-quidditch\ \ As [they]1744-they entered November , the weather turned very cold . [The mountains\ around [the school]994-the school]3405-the mountains\ around the school became icy gray and [the lake]3407-the lake like chilled steel . Every\ morning the ground was covered in frost . [Hagrid]193-hagrid could be seen from the\ upstairs windows defrosting broomsticks on [the Quidditch field]3310-the quidditch field , bundled\ up in a long moleskin overcoat , rabbit fur gloves , and enormous\ beaverskin boots.\ \ The Quidditch season had begun . On Saturday , [Harry]169-harry would be playing in\ [his]169-harry first match after weeks of training : [Gryffindor]385-gryffindor versus [Slytherin]283-slytherin . If\ [Gryffindor]385-gryffindor won , [they]1744-they would move up into second place in the house\ championship.\ \ Hardly [anyone]595-anyone had seen [Harry]169-harry play because [Wood]428-wood had decided that , as\ [their]1744-they secret weapon , [Harry]169-harry should be kept , well , secret . [She\]467-hermlone had also tent [him]169-harry Quidditch Through the Ages , which turned out to be a\ very interesting read.\ \ [Harry]169-harry learned that there were seven hundred ways of committing a\ Quidditch foul and that all of them had happened during a World Cup\ match in 1473 ; that [Seekers]457-seekers were usually [the smallest and fastest\ players]3413-the smallest and fastest\ players , and that most serious Quidditch accidents seemed to happen to\ [them]457-seekers ; that although [people]632-people rarely died playing [Quidditch]278-quidditch , [referees]3415-referees had\ been known to vanish and turn up months later in [the Sahara Desert.\]102-the sahara desert.\ \ [Hermione]334-hermione had become a bit more relaxed about breaking rules since [Harry\]195-harry\ and [Ron]468-ron had saved [her]334-hermione from the mountain troll , and [she]334-hermione was much nicer\ for it . "\[1298-the twins] \ [They]1298-the twins frog - marched [Percy]299-percy from [the room]770-the room , [his]299-percy arms pinned to [his]299-percy side by\ [his]299-percy sweater.\ \ [Harry]149-harry had never in all [his]149-harry life had such a Christmas dinner . A hundred\ fat , roast turkeys ; mountains of roast and boiled potatoes ; platters of\ chipolatas ; tureens of buttered peas , silver boats of thick , rich gravy\ and cranberry sauce -- and stacks of wizard crackers every few feet\ along the table . These fantastic party favors were nothing like the\ feeble Muggle ones [the Dursleys]151-the dursleys usually bought , with [their]151-the dursleys little\ plastic toys and [their]151-the dursleys flimsy paper hats inside . [Harry]149-harry pulled a wizard\ cracker with [Fred]300-fred and it did n't just bang , it went off with a blast like\ a cannon and engulfed [them]1298-the twins all in a cloud of blue smoke , while from the\ inside exploded a [rear admiral]1844-rear admiral 's hat and several live , white mice . [Percy]299-percy nearly broke [his\]299-percy teeth on a silver sickle embedded in [his]299-percy slice . [Harry]149-harry watched [Hagrid\]193-hagrid getting redder and redder in the face as [he]149-harry called for more wine,\ finally kissing [Professor McGonagall]169-harry on the cheek , who , to [Harry's\]296-harry's\ amazement , giggled and blushed , [her]1846-her top hat lopsided.\ \ When [Harry]169-harry finally left the table , [he]169-harry was laden down with a stack of\ things out of the crackers , including a pack of nonexplodable , luminous\ balloons , a Grow - [Your]1847-your - Own - Warts kit , and [his]169-harry own new wizard chess set.\ [The white mice]1848-the white mice had disappeared and [Harry]169-harry had a nasty feeling [they]1848-the white mice were\ going to end up as [Mrs. Norris]399-mrs. norris 's Christmas dinner.\ \ [Harry]169-harry and [the Weasleys]313-the weasleys spent a happy afternoon having a furious snowball\ fight on [the grounds]1486-the grounds . [He]169-harry suspected [he\]169-harry would n't have lost so badly if [Percy]299-percy had n't tried to help [him]169-harry so much.\ \ After a meal of turkey sandwiches , crumpets , trifle , and Christmas cake,\ [everyone]2460-everyone felt too full and sleepy to do much before bed except sit and\ watch [Percy]299-percy chase [Fred]300-fred and [George]301-george all over [Gryffindor tower]385-gryffindor because\ [they]1853-they 'd stolen [his]169-harry prefect badge.\ \ It had been [Harry]169-harry 's best Christmas day ever . Yet something had been\ nagging at the back of [his]169-harry mind all day . Not until [he]169-harry climbed into bed\ was [he]169-harry free to think about it : the invisibility cloak and whoever had\ sent it.\ \ [Ron]468-ron , full of turkey and cake and with nothing mysterious to bother [him,\]169-harry fell asleep almost as soon as [he]169-harry 'd drawn the curtains of [his\]1854-his\ four - poster . [Harry]169-harry leaned over the side of [his]169-harry own bed and pulled the\ cloak out from under it.\ \ [[His]169-harry father]769-his father 's ... this had been [[his]169-harry father]769-his father 's . [He]169-harry let the material flow\ over [his]169-harry hands , smoother than silk , light as air . Use it well , the note\ had said.\ \ [He]169-harry had to try it , now . [He]169-harry slipped out of bed and wrapped the cloak\ around [himself]169-harry . Looking down at [his]169-harry legs , [he]169-harry saw only moonlight and\ shadows . [The whole of [Hogwarts]26-hogwarts]1857-the whole of hogwarts was open to [him\]169-harry in this cloak . [He]169-harry could go anywhere in this , anywhere , and [Filch\]443-filch\ would never know.\ \ [Ron]468-ron grunted in [his]468-ron sleep . Should [Harry]169-harry wake [him]468-ron ? Something held [him]169-harry back\ -- [[his]169-harry father]769-his father 's cloak -- [he]169-harry felt that this time -- the first time -- [he\]169-harry wanted to use it alone.\ \ [He]169-harry crept out of [the dormitory]3316-the dormitory , down [the stairs]1860-the stairs , across [the common room,\]1861-the common room,\ and climbed through the portrait hole.\ \ " Who 's there ? "[1634-the fat lady] squawked [the Fat Lady]1634-the fat lady . [Harry]169-harry said nothing . [He]169-harry walked\ quickly down [the corridor.\]1367-the corridor.\ \ Where should [he]169-harry go ? [He]169-harry stopped , [his]169-harry heart racing , and thought . And then\ it came to [him]169-harry . [The Restricted Section in [the library]3472-the library]1864-the restricted section in the library . [He]169-harry 'd be able to\ read as long as [he]169-harry liked , as long as it took to find out who [Flamel]325-flamel was.\ [He]169-harry set off , drawing the invisibility cloak tight around [him]169-harry as [he\]169-harry walked.\ \ [The library]3472-the library was pitch - black and very eerie . [Harry]169-harry lit a lamp to see [his\]1867-his\ way along the rows of books . The lamp looked as if it was floating along\ in midair , and even though [Harry]169-harry could feel [his]169-harry arm supporting it , the\ sight gave [him]169-harry the creeps.\ \ [The Restricted Section]1868-the restricted section was right at the back of [the library]3472-the library . Step ping\ carefully over the rope that separated these books from [the rest of [the\ library]2582-the\ library]1870-the rest of the\ library , [he]169-harry held up [his]169-harry lamp to read the titles.\ \ [They]1872-they did n't tell [him]169-harry much . [Their]1872-they peeling , faded gold letters spelled\ words in languages [Harry]169-harry could n't understand . Some had no title at all.\ One book had a dark stain on it that looked horribly like blood . The\ hairs on the back of [Harry]169-harry 's neck prickled . Maybe [he]169-harry was imagining it,\ maybe not , but [he]169-harry thought a faint whispering was coming from the books,\ as though [they]1872-they knew [someone]874-someone was there who should n't be.\ \ [He]169-harry had to start somewhere . Setting the lamp down carefully on the floor,\ [he]169-harry looked along the bottom shelf for an interestinglooking book . A large\ black and silver volume caught [his]169-harry eye . [He]169-harry pulled it out with\ difficulty , because it was very heavy , and , balancing it on [his]169-harry knee,\ let it fall open.\ \ A piercing , bloodcurdling shriek split the silence -- the book was\ screaming ! [Harry]169-harry snapped it shut , but the shriek went on and on , one\ high , unbroken , earsplitting note . [He]169-harry stumbled backward and knocked over\ [his]169-harry lamp , which went out at once . Panicking , [he]169-harry heard footsteps coming\ down [the corridor]1509-the corridor outside -- stuffing the shrieking book back on the\ shelf , [he]169-harry ran for it . [He]169-harry passed [Filch]398-filch in the doorway ; [Filch]398-filch 's pale , wild\ eyes looked straight through [him]169-harry , and [Harry]169-harry slipped under [Filch's\]507-filch's\ outstretched arm and streaked off up [the corridor]1509-the corridor , the book 's shrieks\ still ringing in [his]169-harry ears.\ \ [He]169-harry came to a sudden halt in front of a tall suit of armor . [He]169-harry had been\ so busy getting away from [the library]3472-the library , [he]169-harry had n't paid attention to where\ [he]169-harry was going . Perhaps because it was dark , [he]169-harry did n't recognize where [he\]169-harry was at all . There was a suit of armor near [the kitchens]1877-the kitchens , [he]169-harry knew , but [he\]169-harry must be five floors above there.\ \ " [You]169-harry asked [me]169-harry to come directly to [you]169-harry , [Professor]3240-professor , if [anyone]595-anyone was\ wandering around at night , and [somebody]594-somebody 's been in [the library Restricted\ Section]3515-the library restricted\ section . "\[169-harry] \ [Harry]169-harry felt the blood drain out of [his]169-harry face . "\[392-snape] \ [Harry]169-harry stood rooted to the spot as [Filch]398-filch and [Snape]392-snape came around the corner\ ahead . [He]169-harry squeezed through [it]1879-it , holding [his]169-harry breath , trying\ not to move it , and to [his]169-harry relief [he]169-harry managed to get inside [the room\]1880-the room\ without [their]1878-they noticing anything . [They]1878-they walked straight past , and [Harry\]195-harry\ leaned against the wall , breathing deeply , listening to [their]1878-they footsteps\ dying away . That had been close , very close . It was a few seconds before\ [he]169-harry noticed anything about [the room [he]169-harry had hidden in.\]1881-the room he had hidden in.\ \ [It]1880-the room\ looked like [an unused classroom]1882-an unused classroom . There was an inscription carved\ around the top : Erised stra ehru oyt ube cafru oyt on wohsi . [His]169-harry panic\ fading now that there was no sound of Filch and Snape , [Harry]169-harry moved\ nearer to the mirror , wanting to look at [himself]169-harry but see no reflection\ again . [He]169-harry stepped in front of it.\ \ [He]169-harry had to clap [his]169-harry hands to [his]169-harry mouth to stop [himself]169-harry from screaming . [He\]169-harry whirled around . [His]169-harry heart was pounding far more furiously than when the\ book had screamed -- for [he]169-harry had seen not only [himself]169-harry in the mirror , but\ [a whole crowd of people]1884-a whole crowd of people standing right behind [him.\]169-harry \ But [the room]770-the room was empty . Breathing very fast , [he]169-harry turned slowly back to\ the mirror.\ \ There [he]169-harry was , reflected in it , white and scared - looking , and there,\ reflected behind [him]169-harry , were at least ten others . [Harry]169-harry looked over [his\]169-harry shoulder -- but still , [no one]2479-no one was there . Or were [they]1884-a whole crowd of people all invisible,\ too ? Was [he]169-harry in fact in [a room]895-a room full of [invisible people]1888-invisible people and this mirror's\ trick was that it reflected [them]1884-a whole crowd of people , invisible or not?\ \ [He]169-harry looked in the mirror again . "\ \ "[468-ron] How did [you]0-i know --?"\ \ "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't need a cloak to become invisible , " said [Dumbledore]510-dumbledore gently.\ "[0-i] Now , can [you]0-i think what [the Mirror of [Erised]115-erised]1929-the mirror of erised shows [us]1930-us all?"\ \ [Harry]169-harry shook [his]169-harry head.\ \ "[0-i] Let [me]0-i explain . "\[2090-the three of them.\] \ It was the first time [Hermione]334-hermione had ever failed to answer a teacher's\ question . " It does n't take a genius to work it out . "\ \ The sky had turned light before [they]2178-the centaurs stopped talking . [They]2178-the centaurs went to bed\ exhausted , [their]2178-the centaurs throats sore . But the night 's surprises were n't over.\ \ When [Harry]169-harry pulled back [his]169-harry sheets , [he]169-harry found [his]169-harry invisibility cloak\ folded neatly underneath them . There was a note pinned to it:\ \ Just in case.\ \ \ CHAPTER SIXTEEN\ \ THROUGH THE TRAPDOOR\ \ In years to come , [Harry]169-harry would never quite remember how [he]169-harry had managed to\ get through [his]169-harry exams when [he]169-harry half expected [Voldemort]175-voldemort to come bursting\ through the door at any moment . Yet the days crept by , and there could\ be no doubt that [Fluffy]495-fluffy was still alive and well behind the locked door.\ \ It was sweltering hot , especially in [the large classroom where [they]2178-the centaurs did\ [their]2178-the centaurs written papers]3717-the large classroom where they did\ their written papers . [They]2178-the centaurs had been given special , new quills for the\ exams , which had been bewitched with an AntiCheating spell.\ \ [They]2178-the centaurs had practical exams as well . [Professor Flitwick]400-professor flitwick called [them]2178-the centaurs one by\ one into [[his]400-professor flitwick class]785-his class to see if [they]2178-the centaurs could make a pineapple tapdance across\ a desk . [Professor McGonagall]169-harry watched [them]2178-the centaurs turn a mouse into a snuffbox\ -- points were given for how pretty the snuffbox was , but taken away if\ it had whiskers . [Snape]392-snape made [them]2178-the centaurs all nervous , breathing down [their]2178-the centaurs necks\ while [they]2178-the centaurs tried to remember how to make a Forgetfulness potion.\ \ [Harry]169-harry did the best [he]169-harry could , trying to ignore the stabbing pains in [his\]169-harry forehead , which had been bothering [him]169-harry ever since [his]169-harry trip into [the\ forest]1497-the\ forest . [Neville]306-neville thought [Harry]169-harry had a bad case of exam nerves because\ [Harry]169-harry could n't sleep , but the truth was that [Harry]169-harry kept being woken by\ [his]169-harry old nightmare , except that it was now worse than ever because there\ was a hooded figure dripping blood in it.\ \ Maybe it was because [they]2178-the centaurs had n't seen what [Harry]169-harry had seen in [the forest,\]3720-the forest,\ or because [they]2178-the centaurs did n't have scars burning on [their]2178-the centaurs foreheads , but [Ron\]413-ron\ and [Hermione]334-hermione did n't seem as worried about the Stone as [Harry]169-harry .
